name: Ordina
description: Ordina has been a real game-changer for me. Since starting here, I have been able to work on several highly interesting jobs that would otherwise never have crossed my path. The free courses also offer plenty to ponder on.

name: Rabobank
description: Being the second largest bank in the Netherlands claiming about a third of the market, Rabobank is filled to the brim with hundreds of highly skilled nerds. With a mobile banking app serving over six million, this is a place where precision and efficiency are required. We work in a dev-ops environment where each team functions as an autonomous unit, responsible for the complete lifecycle of their own features.

name: Damco
description: Damco, a dutch logistics company with offices and warehouses around the world, requested a team of developers on extremely short notice. This team was to replace the warehouse management system of their warehouse in Göteborg, Sweden, within 3 days, from scratch. Needless to say this was no small feat, however the job was completed satisfactory.

name: Travel Light
description: I have close ties to this bustling start-up company. Currently lead by my girlfriend, they aim to ship your luggage to and from your holiday destination. Start-ups aren't known for their limitless financial wealth, thus can have a hard time finding affordable professionals for their automation needs. I took it upon myself to help out both my partner and her boss by replacing their dysfunctional booking module and offering advice and maintenance.

name: Triple
description: Triple was my first 'real' job as a developer when I got plucked from class the third year of college. They allowed me to try out many different facets of development; web, Android, iOS, and attempted to mold me into a professional developer, although that would take a little more time yet.

name: Adésys
description: My time at Adésys was when I first came into contact with modern javascript frameworks. Here I worked together with specialists from very different disciplines as well as becoming more proficient with microelectronics since Adésys produces and designs its own hardware.

name: OIS
description: OIS delivers digital environments for storing and collecting data from several sources, but most noticeably, webforms and with hospitals and governments as customers, standards are high. I spent a lot of time with my nose inside Oracle databases here.
